content.question:
Neptune intervenes.

Sic ait, et dicto citiuscitus, -a, -um: quick, swift tumida aequoraaequor, -oris, n.: water, sea placat,

collectasque fugatfugo, -are: put to flight, drive away nubes, solemque reducit.

CymothoeCymothoe, -oes, f.: a sea nymph simul et TritonTriton, -onis, m.: a sea god, son of Neptune adnixus acuto

detruduntdetrudo, -ere: push off naves scopulo; levat ipse tridenti.

Aeneid 1.142-145

Translate the passage above as literally as possible.
